articles.author: Hatem Khaled And Mohammed Salem
articles.description: Lashed by the rain and fearful of Israeli bombs, Palestinian civilians headed out of sodden tented camps or family homes in Rafah on Monday to seek refuge elsewhere in the Gaza Strip ahead of an expected Israeli army offensive.
articles.title: To background of bombs, Palestinians flee Rafah to seek shelter elsewhere once again

articles.author: Mohammed Salem, Hatem Khaled
articles.description: Israel called on civilians to evacuate parts of Rafah on Monday in what appeared to be preparation for a long-threatened assault on Hamas holdouts in the southern Gaza Strip city where more than a million war-displaced Palestinians have been sheltering.
articles.title: Israel begins evacuating part of Rafah ahead of threatened assault

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hamas said on Monday that it had accepted a Gaza ceasefire proposal from Egypt and Qatar.
articles.title: Hamas says it accepts ceasefire proposal of Egypt, Qatar

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The judge in the criminal hush money trial of Donald Trump said on Monday that he will consider jail time for the former president for additional violations of the gag order after finding that $1,000 fines are not working as a deterrent.
articles.title: Judge in Trump hush money case to consider jailing Trump

articles.author: Joe Brock, Mike Stone
articles.description: The U.S. Navy's efforts to build a fleet of unmanned vessels are faltering because the Pentagon remains wedded to big shipbuilding projects, according to some officials and company executives, exposing a weakness as sea drones reshape naval warfare.
articles.title: Sea drone warfare has arrived. The U.S. is floundering.

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia on Monday said it would hold a military exercise that will include practice for the use of tactical nuclear weapons after what the defence ministry said were provocative threats from Western officials.
articles.title: Russia to practice tactical nuclear weapon scenario to deter West - defence ministry

articles.author: Julia Harte
articles.description: Columbia University on Monday canceled its main, university-wide commencement ceremony scheduled for May 15 in favor of smaller, school-based events, a decision that follows weeks of pro-Palestinian protests that roiled the Ivy League School.
articles.title: Columbia cancels university-wide commencement ceremony after protests

articles.author: John Irish, Elizabeth Pineau
articles.description: France and the European Commission on Monday told China's President Xi Jingping that they wanted him to use his influence on Russia to end its war in Ukraine, while underscoring that the European Union would not waver in its support for Kyiv.
articles.title: Macron, von der Leyen urge China to press Russia over Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Several people were trapped after a multi-storey building under construction collapsed in the South African city of George, a spokesperson for the municipal government said on Monday.
articles.title: Several people trapped after building collapses in South Africa

articles.author: Valentine Hilaire, Elida Moreno
articles.description: Panama's President-elect Jose Raul Mulino told a cheering crowd moments after he won Sunday's general election that he was "no one's puppet", having parachuted into the presidential race late to replace his former boss Ricardo Martinelli who was barred from running after a money laundering conviction.
articles.title: Panama's Mulino: the president-elect seeking to make his own mark
